title: Fix build-breaking errors causing internal build failure

requirements.text: Resolve the build failure by ensuring all imported React/TypeScript modules compile successfully, with primary focus on empty placeholder component files that currently contain no code.
acceptanceCriteria: `npm run build` (or the projectâ€™s standard frontend build command) completes without TypeScript or bundler errors.

The following placeholder files are no longer empty and each exports a valid React component (or they are removed from all imports/routes if intentionally unused): `frontend/src/components/Hero.tsx`, `frontend/src/components/Products.tsx`, `frontend/src/components/ContactSection.tsx`, `frontend/src/components/CareerSection.tsx`.
The app loads in the browser without a blank screen or runtime import errors.

requirements.text: Add a minimal developer-facing troubleshooting note to help identify similar future build errors (e.g., empty TSX modules, missing exports), and specify the exact command(s) to run to reproduce the error locally.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/DEPLOYMENT.md` (or an appropriate existing dev/deploy doc in the frontend folder) includes a short section explaining how to run the local build and what to check when the build fails due to TypeScript/module errors.
All added documentation text is in English.

constraints: Do not edit any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (read-only UI component sources must be composed, not edited).
Do not modify files in `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, or `frontend/src/main.tsx` (immutable paths).
Keep backend as a single Motoko actor in `backend/main.mo`; add `backend/migration.mo` only if a state upgrade is required.
nonGoals: Do not implement OTP-by-email admin access (email sending is not available).
Do not implement the password-protected admin panel in this change; focus only on fixing the internal/build error first.
